page.title: 11The village shop, Hilmarton.
page.content: The village shop is placed in the centre of Hilmarton.It was built in the year 1876 and the owner is Mr O'Brien.The accomodation at the shop is 6 rooms downstairs,including the shop itself, and also four bedrooms and a toilet upstairs. Mr O'Brien goes to a cash and carry in Keynsham, called Nurdin & Peacock Ltd, every Tuesday. His main suppliers are Hilliars, Snowking and Hales. Twice a week the postman comes to give Mr O'Brien the pensions and stamps, although he comes twice a day for the collection and delivery of mail. He has 3 main staff who are his wife,Mrs Allen and Mrs Green.The times of opening are 08.30 - 18.00 (lunch 13.00 - 14.00.) every day except Tuesday and Saturday, when the shop is closed in the afternoon. The shop is closed on Sunday.
